channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Paramount, Netflix spur Wall Street race to win jumbo loan deals
item.description: Loans of this size have been few and far between over the past couple of years amid subdued acquisition activity. But that’s all changed.

item.title: Supreme Court poised to grant Trump broader firing powers over independent agencies

item.title: Dem-appointed education officials face new scrutiny as Feeding Our Future scandal widens, Trump targets fraud

item.title: Baby boomers have now ‘gobbled up’ nearly one-third of America’s wealth share, and they’re leaving Gen Z and millennials behind
item.description: American septuagenarians hold more than $85 trillion in assets—by far the most of any generation.

item.title: Former FBI agents, fired for kneeling during racial justice protest, sue for reinstatement

item.title: Parents are sacrificing retirement, taking second jobs, and liquidating investments just to afford college for their kids
item.description: More than 60% of parents say they’re delaying retirement to pay for college.

item.title: ICEBlock app maker sues Trump administration for free speech violations
item.description: The maker of an iPhone app that flagged sightings of U.S. immigration agents sued the Trump administration for free speech violations on Monday, alleg...

item.title: Another Year, Another Failed Advent Calendar, And Proof That Waiting Is Hard
item.description: The only path to peace is to trust God, who is strong enough to carry the weight of all the world on his reliable shoulders.

item.title: Why State Courts Should Not Set National Energy Policy
item.description: Judges are improperly turning courts into bastions of climate activism.

item.title: Report: Hegseth Gave Order to Kill Boat Operators Because They Were on a Target List
item.description: Is the Trump administration claiming the power to do what previous administrations have done: compile lists of ‘enemy combatants’ and kill them?

item.description: Senate Republicans have yet to unify behind a plan for the expiring Obamacare subsidies, while Senate Democrats have offered a proposal that is likely...

item.title: Jared Kushner suddenly emerges in the Warner brawl between Paramount and Netflix, backed by Saudi billions and fresh off brokering another megadeal
item.description: Trump’s son-in-law is emerging as a central conduit for Gulf money moving into American media, and they’re backing the Ellisons and Paramount.

item.title: Ben Rhodes Keeps Getting It Wildly Wrong on Israel and Gaza
item.description: Setting the record straight on the recent New York Times screed by Obama’s deputy national security adviser.

item.title: White House turns up heat on Biden’s economic record as voters sour on ‘affordability’
item.description: Trump tours battleground states promoting affordability messaging as Democrats sweep 2025 elections using economic concerns as winning strategy.

item.title: Pope Leo Reveals His Secret
item.description: What a 17th-century monk can still teach us.

item.title: The Ops Against Pete Hegseth Are Designed To Further A Color Revolution
item.description: The attacks on Pete Hegseth are not just the usual insanity, but a progression of the left's color revolution.

item.title: ‘This isn’t what Walt and Roy would have wanted’: Disney fans with disabilities sue over new ride restrictions
item.description: Disney narrowed the scope to guests who “due to a developmental disability such as autism or similar” have difficulties waiting in a long line.

item.title: Rein In the Presidential Pardon Power
item.description: A bipartisan pattern of executive abuse shows why the unilateral power to pardon should be reconsidered.

item.title: If You Care About The Future Of College Football, Cheer For Texas Tech In The Playoff
item.description: Texas Tech’s 2025 team turned the blue blood college football hierarchy on its head. That’s a feat worth celebrating.
